meanings.definition: To offer or suggest a plan or idea for consideration.
meanings.sent1: She propositioned her friends to go on a picnic this weekend.
meanings.sent2: The company propositioned a new marketing strategy to increase sales.
meanings.sent3: John propositioned a game night to his friends for some fun.
meanings.sent4: The teacher propositioned a creative project to engage the students.
meanings.sent5: The team leader propositioned a team-building activity to boost morale.

meanings.definition: To make a proposal of a sexual nature to someone.
meanings.sent1: He propositioned her for a date after work.
meanings.sent2: She felt uncomfortable when he propositioned her inappropriately.
meanings.sent3: The bold stranger propositioned her at the bar, but she declined politely.
meanings.sent4: The character in the movie propositioned the main character in a surprising twist.
meanings.sent5: The comedian jokingly propositioned the audience for a laugh.
